intro: Trachymene effusa, commonly known as the common false shamrock, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, white or pale blue flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Trachymene effusa is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in native gardens.
